text: Zliv (; ) is a town in České Budějovice District in the South Bohemian Region of the Czech Republic. It has about 3,600 inhabitants. ==History== The first recorded reference to Zliv dates back to 1409. By the end of the 19th century the economic expansion of the village began to take place as local factories started manufacturing ceramic material and fireproof goods. Considerable industrialization did not occur until the latter half of the 20th century when the village was officially declared a small industrial town. ==References== ==External links== * Official website Category:Populated places in České Budějovice District Category:Cities and towns in the Czech Republic
title: Zliv
